Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a fish with labels for the parts such as fins, tail, and eyes.
The student can depict and label water as the environment where the fish lives.
The student can include other plants and animals found in the fish's habitat, such as aquatic plants and other fish.
The student can effectively label elements that fish need, such as water and food (e.g., algae, plankton).
The student can show and label how different parts of the habitat, like plants providing oxygen, help the fish survive.
The student can articulate through their drawing how the fish and its environment form a system that works together (e.g., the fish eats and helps control algae while plants provide oxygen).
CANNOT: The student may sometimes omit minor labels (e.g., small elements like bubbles or specific types of algae).
The student might occasionally forget to include every possible plant or animal in the environment, focusing instead on the major ones that illustrate the habitat system.
